title: Assign permissions to a role for Administration modules
content:
This section provides instructions on how to grant a selected role the desired permissions to individual modules under Administration in the main menu. 

Unlike other modules under Plan, Build, and Run in the main menu, each module under Administration uses two-layer access control: visibility control and permission control:

  • Visibility control: this layer controls whether the menu item is visible to a role, by using a Visible checkbox. 
  • Permission control: this layer controls whether the role has the permissions to create and update the configurations or data in the module. If the module has multiple tabs, the system enables you to define more granular access control for each tab of the module. This layer uses a combination of CRUD (Create, Read (View), Update, and Delete) permissions for the corresponding record types or resources and other required permission settings available on the Role form. 

Take the Administration > Master Data > People module for example. First, you need to select the Visible checkbox to make the menu item visible to the role, and then grant the role different permissions to use individual tabs under People: People, Groups, Roles, Entitlement Rules, and Encryption Domains. 

To assign permissions to a role for the administration modules, log in to the agent interface, navigate to Administration > People > Roles, create a new role or open an existing role, and then follow the instructions below. 

To manage roles, you must either have the Tenant Admin role or have your tenant admin grant appropriate role management permissions to you as described in the Grant permissions for modules available to other roles section. 
For information about the out-of-the-box roles and instructions on how to create a new role or update an existing role, see Roles.

Modules that are restricted only to the Tenant Admin role

These modules are identified as Others in the Administration menu visibility section of a role definition: 

  • Administration > Configuration > Studio
  • Administration > Configuration > Lists
  • Administration > Configuration > Application Settings
  • Administration > Utilities > Packages
  • Administration > Utilities > Sample Data
  • Administration > Configuration > Virtual Agent Settings
  • Administration > Configuration > Smart Analytics Settings

Only the Tenant Admin role can manage these modules. The system prohibits other roles from administering these modules even if you make them visible to the roles. Pay attention to the following:

  • The Application Settings module is also available to the Self-Service Portal Administrator role. 
  • CRUD (Create, View, Update, and Delete) permissions for the Package record type enable a role to create and update Package records; however, only the Tenant Admin role can conduct the Export and Import operations for packages. Without the ability to export and import packages, CRUD permissions for package records don't bring any real value. For this reason, it makes little sense to make this module visible to a role other than Tenant Admin. 
  • If you select the Ability to view all administration modules checkbox for a role, all administration modules (including those restricted to the Tenant Admin role only) are visible to the role; however, the role can do nothing but view the Studio, Lists, and Application Settings modules.

Grant permissions for modules available to other roles

The following modules are available to roles other than Tenant Admin:

  • Service Portal Settings
  • Orchestration Settings
  • Routing Definitions
  • People 
  • Locations
  • Categories
  • Dashboard Definitions
  • Integration
  • Providers
  • Audit

You can also define custom modules that are available under Administration > Master Data. 

To grant permissions for the modules to the selected role, select the Visible checkbox for each desired module in the Administration menu visibility section to make the menu item of the module visible to the role, and then grant further permissions as described in the following. 

Tip Instead of selecting Visible for an individual module, you can select the Ability to view all administration modules checkbox to automatically select all modules, and then deselect unwanted modules if needed. 

Administration > Configuration > Service Portal Settings

For menu visibility, select Visible for Service Portal Settings. 

Grant further permissions to the role for accessing the three tabs below: Feature Settings, Configuration Settings, and Theme Settings.

Feature Settings

This tab is restricted only to the Tenant Admin role and Self-Service Portal Administrator role.

Configuration Settings

This tab is restricted only to the Tenant Admin role.  

Theme Settings

This tab is available to other roles if you grant the required permissions to the role:

  1. In the Self-service portal administration section, select the Customize the look and feel of the self-service portal checkbox. 
  2. Grant the following permissions:
    • GRUD permissions for the Theme settings and Theme config resources
    • View permission for the Entitlement Rule record type

Administration > Configuration > Orchestration Settings

The orchestration settings are visible only if you have installed the Operations Orchestration capability. 

For menu visibility, select Visible for Orchestration Settings to allow the role to access this Operations Orchestration Containerized menu item. 

To access this setting, the user must have either of the following roles:

  • The out-of-the-box role OO_ADMINISTRATORS
  • A custom role that has the oo_topologyRead and oo_topologyManage permissions defined in IdM

To access OO data, select Permission to manage Operations Orchestration for the role. 

Administration > Configuration > Routing Definitions

For menu visibility, select Visible for Routing Definitions. 

Grant CRUD permissions for the DecisionTree resource. 

Administration > Master Data > People

For menu visibility, select Visible for People. 

To grant CRUD permissions for the tabs below of this module, follow the instructions below. 

People

  1. Grant CRUD permissions for the Person record type so that the current role can create and update Person records.
  2. Grant extra permissions to enable the role to update the Role and License fields of a Person record:
    • For the Role field: CRUD permissions for the Authorization Principal Resource resource and View permission for the Role Resource resource
    • For the License field: CRUD permissions for the License Users resource, and View permission for the License resource

Groups

  1. Grant CRUD permissions for the Group record type.
  2. To enable the role to update the Role field of a Group record, grant CRUD permissions for the Authorization Principal Resource resource and View permission for the Role Resource resource. 

Roles

Grant CRUD permissions for the Role Resource resource.

Entitlement Rules

Grant CRUD permissions for the Entitlement rule definition resource and CRUD permissions for the Entitlement Rule record type. Note that View permission for the Entitlement Rule record type is required to see this tab.

Encryption Domains

In the Security section, select the Encryption domain administrator checkbox. This tab is visible only when this checkbox is selected.

Administration > Master Data > Locations

For menu visibility, select Visible for Locations.

For data access, grant CRUD permissions for the Location record type.

Administration > Master Data > Categories

For menu visibility, select Visible for Categories.

For data access, grant CRUD permissions for the Record Category record type.

Administration > Master Data > Dashboard Definitions

For menu visibility, select Visible for Dashboard Definitions.

For data access, grant CRUD permissions for the Dashboard Definition record type. If the role also needs permission to set a system default dashboard, additionally grant the Admin permission.

To allow the role to create public or group dashboard definitions, in the Reports & Views section, grant the following permissions, respectively:

  • Create public dashboards
  • Create group dashboards

Administration > Utilities > Integration

For menu visibility, select Visible for Integration.

To grant full access to all tabs of the module, select the Administrator checkbox in the On-Premise Bridge section for administration privileges. 

Administration > Utilities > Providers

The Providers module is available only when the Design and Deploy (DND) capability is enabled or both the Design and Deploy (DND) capability and Cloud Cost Reporting capability are enabled. 

To authorize users to access DND and Cloud Cost Reporting menu items, in addition to configuring role permissions in Service Management, the tenant admin also needs to ask the suite admin to configure authorization. For more information, see Configure authorization for Design and Deploy.

To grant further permissions to the tabs below of this module, follow the instructions below. 

Aggregation Providers

  1. Go to Administration > Configuration > Application Settings, set Enable aggregation to On.
  2. Grant CRUD permissions for the Provider record type.

Image Aggregation Providers and Deployment Resource Providers

  1. In Administration > Configuration > Application Settings, make sure that Experience mode includes Cloud Management.
  2. In the General section of the role definition, select the Permission to manage Service Design and Deployment checkbox.

Cloud Cost Data Providers

  1. In Administration > Configuration > Application Settings, make sure that Enable Cloud Cost Reporting is set to On and Experience mode includes Cloud Management.
  2. In the General section of the role definition, select the Permission to manage Cloud Management Platform FinOps checkbox.

Administration > Utilities > Audit

For menu visibility, select Visible for Audit. 

For data access, see Audit roles and permissions. 

Administration > Master Data > <custom module>

You can define custom modules under Administration > Master Data. 

To enable the current role to use a custom module:

  1. Select the Visible checkbox for the module. 
  2. Grant GRUD permissions for the record type of the custom module.
